trans-unit.source: How to Manage Assets in Media Services
trans-unit.target: How to Manage Assets in Media Services

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage assets on Media Services. You can also manage jobs, tasks, access policies, locators, and more. Code samples are written in C# and use the Media Services SDK for .NET.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage assets on Media Services. You can also manage jobs, tasks, access policies, locators, and more. Code samples are written in C# and use the Media Services SDK for .NET.

trans-unit.source: How to: Manage Assets in storage
trans-unit.target: How to: Manage Assets in storage

trans-unit.source: After you create media assets, you can access and manage the assets on the server.
trans-unit.target: After you create media assets, you can access and manage the assets on the server.

trans-unit.source: You can also manage other objects on the server that are part of Media Services, including jobs, tasks, access policies, locators, and more.
trans-unit.target: You can also manage other objects on the server that are part of Media Services, including jobs, tasks, access policies, locators, and more.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to query for an asset by assetId.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to query for an asset by assetId.

trans-unit.source: To list all assets available on the server, you can use the following method which iterates through the assets collection, and display details about each asset.
trans-unit.target: To list all assets available on the server, you can use the following method which iterates through the assets collection, and display details about each asset.

trans-unit.source: The following code snippet deletes all the assets from the Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: The following code snippet deletes all the assets from the Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: Note, if an asset is associated with a program, you first must delete the program.
trans-unit.target: Note, if an asset is associated with a program, you first must delete the program.
